fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira page-load-times are taking more time than usual.
Specifically, the files batch.js and batch.css take much longer time to load, sometimes in the range of 10s of seconds.
The issue is reproducible on all browsers.
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.10.x, 7.11.x, or 7.12.x
 * Jira runs under load, many concurrent users 100+ concurrent users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a loaded Jira instance, try to load any page, eg: Issue navigator.

h3. Expected Results,

The page should load in a reasonable time.
 * _Issue navigator on jira.atlassian.com load in around 3 seconds._
 * Resources are cached at the Jira side and not recompiled

h3. Actual Results
 * The page takes much longer time to load.
 !Screenshot_20181005_153609.png|thumbnail!
 * Some resources are *not* cached at the Jira side and recompiled on every page view
 * Taking thread dumps we see multiple user threads running the below Mozilla Rhino compiler code for Javascript and CSS resources:
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-1814" #172656 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f7d8c2c7000 nid=0x6615 runnable [0x00007f7cf2472000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptableObject.createSlot(ScriptableObject.java:2836)
        - locked <0x00000007bc210c88> (a org.mozilla.javascript.NativeCall)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptableObject.getSlot(ScriptableObject.java:2756)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptableObject.putImpl(ScriptableObject.java:2640)
--
"http-nio-8080-exec-1812" #172655 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f7d8c10c800 nid=0x6614 runnable [0x00007f7cf65c8000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at org.mozilla.javascript.optimizer.OptRuntime.call2(OptRuntime.java:42)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.gen._js_less_less_rhino_js_1._c_anonymous_205(/js/less/less-rhino.js:3196)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.gen._js_less_less_rhino_js_1.call(/js/less/less-rhino.js)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.optimizer.OptRuntime.call1(OptRuntime.java:32)
--
"http-nio-8080-exec-1809" #172636 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f7d8063d800 nid=0x65ab runnable [0x00007f7d244cf000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at org.mozilla.javascript.BaseFunction.createObject(BaseFunction.java:383)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.BaseFunction.construct(BaseFunction.java:339)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.newObject(ScriptRuntime.java:2348)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.gen._js_less_less_rhino_js_1._c_anonymous_80(/js/less/less-rhino.js:1691)
{code}

No errors are noticed in the logs.
h3. Notes
 * In Jira version 7.10.0, a piece of logic was introduced to a file that lists resources to import on some pages, e.g. on the backlog view.
 * Due to the added logic, the file became dynamic, and thus Jira is unable to cache this file or any of the imported resources.
 * As a result, Jira needs to recompile some LESS files on every page view. This operation is CPU intensive and can create a performance bottleneck.
 * The piece of logic was added in Jira 7.10.0 and was removed in Jira 7.13.0.

h3. Workaround

Please upgrade Jira to version 7.13.0 or newer to receive the fix. Unfortunately, there are no known workarounds for the problem.
fields.summary: Loading of batch.js and batch.css is slow making page load time longer in JIRA

h3. Problem experienced

Search requests via API (_/rest/api/2/search_) can consistently fail on a DC node with a ClassCastException, under a set of very particular circumstances:
 - Jira DC,
 - full cache flush,
 - some unidentified (but very rare) condition that makes a node load wrong Spring library via OSGI.

The error stops some caches from working and will result in an intensified number of database queries executed, possibly making the performance of an entire DC cluster _a lot_ worse, and even making it unresponsive.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom field search field refresh rate prevents Chinese character input while using IME 
h3. Environment
 * Using any Input Method Editor (IME) to input Chinese, Japanese character.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a new custom field with Chinese character.
 !Custom fields - Jira 7.12.1 - Google Chrome 2018-10-23 17.43.46.png|thumbnail!
 # Search the custom field using custom field search field.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA able to search for the custom field and IME did not get cut.

h3. Actual Results
IME get cut off halfway before it can convert the character to Chinese.
 !CustomField.gif! 
[^Custom Field.mp4]

h3. Workaround
Convert the Chinese character in a notepad and paste the converted Chinese custom field to the search field.
fields.summary: Custom field search field refresh rate prevents Chinese character input while using IME

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you add a description to the status 'To Do' to the default language (US - English), it will appear in the Status page. However, when you change your personal language to another language, the description will not appear. This is only observed with the status 'To Do' which is bundled with Jira. 
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Go to *Issues* > *Status*
 # Head to the status *To Do* and click on *Edit*. Add a description to the Status, then click *Update*.
 # Click on *Add Status* and add a Status with the name, *Investigating* and description, *Investigating this issue*.
 # Head to your profile and change the language to French.
 # Go to *Status* and observe that the description of *To Do* does not appear. However, the description of *Investigating* appears.

h3. Expected Results

The status *To Do* will appear with the default description edited when it is not translated in another language.
h3. Actual Results

The status *To Do* description will not appear.
h3. Workaround

Add a translation for *To Do* in every language.
h3. Note

The description will appear when you are in the *Status Translations* page.
fields.summary: Description of the status 'To Do' will not appear when personal language is changed

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
JIRA Anonymous User Is Able To Search For Creator Name Via [*JQL Search Screen*|http://localhost:8080/issues/?jql=] By Insert Full User Name Even When *Browse User* Global Permission Doesn't Allow "*Anyone*". This is definitely not an expected behavior if "Browse User" wasn't set to anyone.

Although it will only show when full name entered matched, but this is still considered as a security issue. An attacker can use this bug to identify which user ID available in JIRA.

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version: 7.12.3

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Open up *JQL Search URL* http://localhost:8080/issues/?jql= (This link can access directly even without login.
# Select *More* > *Creator* > Key in a username in full for example *admin.jira*
# It will show the user when username matched JIRA available user as below:-
 !image-2018-10-23-16-17-55-782.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*
# It shouldn't show any username.
# Besides, we shouldn't even able to access the JQL page if anonymous user access is not allowed.

h3. *Actual Results*
# JQL Page Opened and we are able to key in full username, JIRA will show it out when it is available in JIRA user directory.

h3. *Workaround*
Installing this plugin will force the user to login before they able to access to JQL Search page
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213129/prevent-anonymous-access?hosting=server&tab=support
fields.summary: JIRA Anonymous User Able To Search Creator Name In JQL Search When Key In Full User Name Even When Browse User Permission Doesn't Allow Anyone

fields.description:
h2. Problem

[Jira Data Center documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/installing-jira-data-center-861253059.html/] suggests to copy the 'cache folder' to Shared HOME.

 
{quote}Copy the following directories into /data/jira/sharedhome: (some of them may be empty)
 data
 plugins
 logos
 import
 export
 caches
{quote}
 

However, the following command from the documentation does not mention the cache folder :
{noformat}
$ cp -R /path/to/jira-local-home/{data,plugins,logos,import,export} /data/jira/sharedhome
{noformat}
Although the cache folder should be created new instead of being copied from the Home directory. The current documentation is confusing for the customers. So we need to update the documentation.

 

Here is a bug that customers can run into because of missing cache folder https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65488
fields.summary: Jira Data Center Installation guide incomplete about copying cache folder to shared home

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you click on *watch issue* or *stop watching* an issue, the *Watch issue* menu item under *More* menu on the issue navigator gets misaligned. This is only applicable if the user does not refresh or navigate away from the page. 
h3. Suggested Solution
 To fix the alignment to be the same as all other menu items.
h3. Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Alignment of Watch Issue menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When:

# Installing the Checklist for Jira add-on and add a Checklist Custom Field
# Then adding values to the Checklist Field
# And finally exporting to JSON

The process crashes because it assumes that the Checklist custom field is an option since it implements some interfaces related to Options.

h3. Asks
A way to control jira export mechanism or for the plugin to protect the customer from this crash

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: JSON exporter crashes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When install Jira with Japanese Default language, Basic search development field is not working. It will display error "フィールド 'development' が存在しないか、そのフィールドを閲覧する権限を持っていません。(Field 'development' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.)" .

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira with Japanese Default language
 # Connect with Bitbucket Server or Bitbucket Cloud or Github or Bamboo
 # Search issue by Basic and select "Development(開発)" field
 # Error message "フィールド 'development' が存在しないか、そのフィールドを閲覧する権限を持っていません。(Field 'development' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.)" will be displayed and it doesn't return any issue

h3. Expected Results
- When user search issue with "Development(開発)" field by Basic search, return correct result without error message
- JQL should be "{{開発[commits].all > 0}}" not "{{development[commits].all > 0}}"

h3. Actual Results
- When user search issue with "Development(開発)" field by Basic, JQL will be "{{development[commits].all > 0}}"
- Error message "フィールド 'development' が存在しないか、そのフィールドを閲覧する権限を持っていません。(Field 'development' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.)" will be displayed

h3. Workaround
- Change search type Basic to Advance
- Change JQL "{{development[commits].all > 0}}" to "{{開発[commits].all > 0}}"
fields.summary: Basic search Development field is not working when install Jira with Japanese Default language

fields.description:
As Jira instances grow in size and complexity, there are increasing numbers of projects, issue types, schemes, etc.

See:
!quickcreate-size.png|thumbnail! 

This request is also performed every single time an user clicks on the "Create" button.  If there are no changes to the list of parameters, browser should not need to request the entire list again.

h5. Workaround
A workaround is to ensure that gzip compression is enabled either in Jira or on the network layer, but *not both*.  Compression in multiple layers will result in content parsing problems.
fields.summary: Reduce Create Issue Request Size

It appears that the Offline Documentation is not updated to the latest version for some of the products if we refer to the link below:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/alldoc/jira-documentation-directory-71598773.html

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
Applying formatting to adjacent characters that remain unformatted in the visual editor results in failure to properly render.

Example: In this sentence, the word, "*sent*ence" has the first four letters set to bold, and the remaining characters unformatted.

When we send comments to users, we will frequently mark a portion of a word in bold print to draw attention to a piece of a word or statement. An example would be when explaining to use a SAM or UPN  login to a user, where you might say, "Please use *domain*\username to login.)

Result: The word "sentence" would be displayed in the portal and in the email sent to the reporter in the following way, in descriptive text, so this editor doesn't re-format on submit: asterisk-s-e-n-t-asterisk-e-n-c-e
fields.summary: Visual editor - applying mixed formatting to adjacent characters broken

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The attachment list is not aligned properly if the user has only the Delete Own Attachments permission

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a new project, let's say a Business project type. 
# Create two user: 
#* *User A* with the *Delete Own Attachments*. (affected one) 
#* *User B* with the *Delete All Attachments* permission. 
# Create a new issue. 
# Upload some attachments with both User A and User B. 
# Change the attachment view to List view instead of Thumbnails view. 
# You noticed that the User A view has a misaligned list of items. 

h3. *Expected Results*

Expecting the same view as User B. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-19 at 5.25.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Actual Results*

But User A sees this view instead. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-19 at 5.25.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: The attachment list is not aligned properly if the user has only the Delete Own Attachments permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

h3. Why this is important
Easier user experience

fields.description:
*Summary*

Navigating any screen with the Rich text editor allows you to get to the editor, but once inside you can not move back with Shift-Tab. 

This creates a problem with navigation when a mouse can not be used for navigation (for example when the NVDA screen reader is used).


*Environment*
Customer's reported environment:
Firefox : 62.0.3
NVDA : 2018.3.2

We have tested with Firefox 62.0, Chrome 69.0.3497.100 and Safari 11.1.2.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Install the NVDA screen reader
 # Open any screen that contains the Rich text editor
 # Navigate to the editor using the Tab key
 # Once inside the editor, use the Shift-Tab key to try to navigate backwards.

*Expected Results*
Shift-Tab should move back out from the editor to the previous step.

*Actual Results*
Shift-Tab doesn't do anything and the cursor remains inside the editor.

*Note*
This only happens under the *Visual* tab in the editor. In the *Text* tab you can still navigate back with Shift-Tab.

*Workaround*
The only known workaround to date is to completely disable the Rich text editor under *Administration > System > User interface > Rich text editor*
fields.summary: Jira Accessibility: Shift-Tab can not be used to navigate out of the Rich text editor

fields.description:
If you define in a permission scheme that a group has "resolve issues" permission but NOT "close issues" permission, they're still able to close the issue because the "Resolve & Close" button is always visible.


h1. workaround 

Add a permission validator in the workflow : check for the user permission  : close issue.
fields.summary: Users can close issues even if they don't have the "Close issues" permission

When upgrading to JIRA 7.12 (e.g.: From JIRA 7.2), the startup will throw a warning about the database connection URL, stating that the "storage_engine" parameter has been deprecated and needs to be replaced with "default_storage_engine" parameter.

However, according to [Startup check: Changing your MySQL connection URL for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/startup-check-changing-your-mysql-connection-url-for-jira-874744240.html] KB article, the "default_storage_engine" parameter should only be applied to instances with MySQL 5.7 and above.

h3. Expected Results
No warning message during startup

h3. Actual Results
Warning message appears
 !Selection_267.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Click "Ignore all warnings and continue"
fields.summary: Upgrading to JIRA 7.12 with MySQL 5.5 is prompting database connection URL warning

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Internal directory user's password needs to match the one in Crowd in the following conditions.

* SSO is enabled
* Jira Internal Directory is in a higher position than Crowd Directory in [User Directories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-user-directories-938847049.html] setting

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# [Integrating Crowd with Atlassian Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/integrating-crowd-with-atlassian-jira-192625.html]
# Create a user who has same username in in each directory as follows
#* Jira Internal Directory:
#** username: testuser
#** password: *password1*
#* Crowd Directory:
#** username: testuser
#** password: *password2*
# Move Jira Internal Directory in a higher position than Crowd Directory in _Administration > User management > User Directories_
# Enable SSO with following instruction in the above page
# Try to login Jira with the latter one (in Crowd Directory) credential
#* Please login Jira from Jira's login page and do not login from Crowd or the other SSO enabled applications

h3. Expected Results

As [the document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/integrating-crowd-with-atlassian-jira-192625.html] said,

bq. It is possible to define multiple user directories in Jira. However, if you enable SSO integration, you will only be able to authenticate as users from the Crowd server defined in the crowd.properties file.

the credential in Crowd Directory should be used for the authentication and the login should succeed.

h3. Actual Results

The login failed. Even if we try to login with the credential in Jira Internal Directory, it failed as well. It means both of the passwords need to match each other.
 
h3. Notes

The user seemed to be authenticated twice by both Jira Internal Directory and Crowd Directory in this situation.

There was also [a suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28994] which asked for disabling other directories than Crowd if SSO was enabled but it was already closed as "Won't Fix".

h3.Workaround

We can still login Jira from other SSO enabled applications' login page.
fields.summary: Internal directory user's password needs to match the one in Crowd if SSO is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tab focus in Jira 7.10 and 7.11 when searching for issues in a project is invisible.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few issues in a project and search for the issues under the *Issues* tab.
# Tab through the different buttons on the screen until you get to the issues in the sidebar to tab through.


h3. Expected Results

You can visually see the issues you are tabbing through in the issue panel.


h3. Actual Results

The tabbing goes out of focus and is invisible and the focus remains on the issue at the top of the filter although it's clear you are tabbing through issues. On the bottom of the screen on Chrome, you can clearly see that you have tabbed to a different issue when hovering over and the focus on that issue will come back when you click Enter.


h3. Notes

I could not reproduce this on Jira 7.6.8 or 7.7.2. This can be easily reproduced on JAC and versions starting at 7.10.


h3.Workaround

Click on the issues directly without tabbing through them so focus remains on the issue or use the J and K hotkeys to tab through the issue.
fields.summary: Tab focus on issue search from projects is invisible.

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

It'd be useful to have REST endpoints for these:
 # Check which users have CAPTCHA required
 # Reset failed login count for individual users
 # Reset failed login count for all users

h3. Workaround
To check which users have CAPTCHA required:
# Go to JIRA Administration -> System -> General Configuration
# Get the value of Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed
# Use that value in the below SQL query (3 is default):
{code}
select u.id, u.user_name, u.display_name, u.directory_id, a.attribute_name, a.attribute_value
from cwd_user u inner join cwd_user_attributes a on u.id = a.user_id
where a.attribute_name = 'invalidPasswordAttempts' and a.attribute_value >= 3;
{code}

To reset failed login count:
* [How to reset failed login count from within JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-reset-failed-login-count-from-within-jira-442270086.html]
* [How to reset failed login count from JIRA application Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-reset-failed-login-count-from-jira-application-database-329352344.html]
fields.summary: Create REST endpoints for checking and resetting CAPTCHA

fields.description:
JIRA synchronization with the AD will remove any occurrence of duplicated groups in the AD tree with the following example message, even if the group is on different locations of the AD tree.
{code:java}
WARN [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.model.DirectoryEntities] filterOutDuplicates entity [GROUPNAME] of type LDAPGroupWithAttributes duplicated in remote directory. Ignoring all occurrences.
{code}
This message occurs for each duplicated group found and the application will remove all occurrences of the group during the sync.

If you are using the "Update group memberships when logging in" for "every time the user login in", the application will add the group into JIRA groups during the user login action, removing the group again on the subsequent synchronization causing the strange symptom of losing and gaining permissions regularly.

h4. Expected results

JIRA should merge all occurrences of duplicated groups, aggregating each group members into a singular group on JIRA UI.

h4. Workaround

The only known workaround is to write up a [group filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-write-ldap-search-filters-792496933.html] and filter the duplicated groups out of the sync. Since the groups have the same name, you must filter using an attribute that differs them to take effect.
fields.summary: Duplicated groups in AD are removed from JIRA after synchronization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the documentation of ["Increasing JIRA application memory"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/increasing-jira-application-memory-938847654.html] it mentions that:
{quote}
h4. Guidance

As a rule of thumb, if you have fewer than 5000 issues, Jira applications should run well with the default 768 MB. Granting Jira applications too much memory can impact performance negatively, so it is best to start with 768 MB, and make modest increases as necessary. As another data point, 40,000 works well with 768 MB to 1 GB.
{quote}
This seems to be a really rare case where the Default Memory could cater to 5000 issues including 1GB for 40000 issues. Except that the instance does not have any plugin installed and the concurrent users are low.

This section seems to not update since JIRA 4 and even in JIRA Sizing Guide below for JIRA 6.4, for low scale instance, the recommended Memory for JIRA is more than 1GB.
- [JIRA Sizing Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html]

h3. Suggested Solution:
To remove the section completely or replace it with the current pages that we have such as:
- [JIRA Sizing Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html]
- [JIRA Data Center size profiles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-size-profiles-955171062.html]
fields.summary: Update on "Increasing JIRA application" documentation

SCRIPT5022: IssueTable hasn't been properly initialized
batch.js (3859,1944)
JEP FSM - Event: WIKI_EDITOR_INITIALIZED 
   "JEP FSM - Event:"
   "WIKI_EDITOR_INITIALIZED"
   [
      length: 0
   ]

JEP FSM - Current state: Attached
JEP FSM - Next State: Hidden
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using Kotlin to create a Jira plugin,  one runs into this problem very quickly:
 [https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19515]

The problem is, that Kotlin inheritance respects generics. There are many classes in the Jira source code and/or it's libraries that do not use generics and instead use the raw type.

For example:
 * com.atlassian.jira.util.ErrorColleciton - uses Generics
 * webwork.action.ActionSupport - does not use Generics
 * This leads to a clash of signatures in com.atlassian.jira.web.action.JiraWebActionSupport:
 ** setErrorMessages(Collection)
 ** setErrorMessages(Collection<String>)
 * This is fine for the Java compiler. However, the Kotlin compiler is more strict here.
 * Thus, in Kotlin, just subclassing JiraWebActionSupport will lead to a compile error

h3. Suggested Solution
 * The problem cannot be fixed at client/call side (the plugin).
 * Adaption of the Jira source code and it's dependencies is necessary.
 * Specifically, scan all Java files and add missing generics.
 * Specifically, webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar should have generics added (or rather, it should be replaced with a 1.5 version of the library), as this contains the often needed Action base classes.
 * There should not be anything blocking adding generics going forward, as Jira already requires Java 1.8 as stated on "Supported platforms" page

h3. Why this is important

Kotlin is picking up momentum and it can be expected that more and more plugins will be created with Kotlin

Kotlin was on the "Adopt" stage of the Atlassian Tech Radar this year. So if we shall adopt, let's make it as smooth as possible
h3. Workaround

Whenever you need to extend a Jira base class that will lead to such a compile error in Kotlin, create the subclass as a Java class instead.
fields.summary: Improve Kotlin interoparability

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After a custom field context change from global to per project, the custom field will disappear from screens in projects where it is not applicable. 
However, The values of the custom field on issues from projects where it's not applicable are *not* removed from the database table *customfieldvalue*.

h3. Suggested Solution
After a custom field context change to only apply to certain projects, all values of the custom field in issues that belong to the excluded projects should be deleted. 

h3. Workaround
* While a *SQL DELETE* statement is feasible, this option is to be avoided. 
* A re-index will remove issues from searches in projects where it's not applicable. 
* The UI will not display any values for this custom field in the excluded projects.
fields.summary: Jira should remove the unused custom field values from the database after a context change

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Not all webhook events provide the same URL variables. This can lead to scenarios where a single webhook has multiple events - but the webhook will not always execute consistently, because some variables will not be present.

Currently, the list of variables is:

 * *board* related webhooks: *board.id*
 * *sprint* related webhooks: *sprint.id*
 * *attachment* related webhooks: *attachment**.id*
 * *comment* related webhooks: *comment.id*
 * *issue* related webhooks: *issue.id, issue.key, project.id, project.key*
 * *project* related webhooks: *project.id, project.key*
 * *version* related webhooks: *project.id, project.key, version.id*
 * *version merge* webhook: *mergedVersion.id*
 * *worklog* related webhooks: *worklog.id*

The following event types *do not provide any URL variables*:
* Issue Link related webhooks:
* Features status change related webhooks (voting, watching, etc)

(Please note that this list may change in the future)

h3.Suggested Solution
All webhook events should provide a bare minimum of variables, where it makes sense to do so.

h3. Why this is important
This is important so webhooks operate consistently when multiple events have been selected.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I'd like for webhook events to more consistently provide variables in the URL so I can ensure my webhooks work consistently

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the webhooks UI to create or edit webhooks, some variables will be allowed to be used in the URL.

However, not all event types provide the same URL variables; and it's not entirely clear which event types provide certain URL variables.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a clearer way in the UI for an administrator to see which variables are provided by which event type.
h3. Why this is important

Administrators may create webhooks with multiple events to make management easier - but if an event fires (that does not provide the variable) then the webhook will not behave as expected.
h3. Workaround

You can insert the following CSS into Jira's Announcement Banner - it will make the "All variables are available" and "Some variables are available" states clearer so Administrators can at least see the difference.
{code:java}
<style type="text/css">
.webhooks .variable-intersection { font-weight: bold; color: #36B37E !important; }
.webhooks .variable-some { font-weight: bold; color: #FFAB00 !important; }
</style>
{code}
Please ensure you test this change in a test environment first, before applying to production. If you see [unusual behaviour in pages after applying this fix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-pages-go-hidden-or-blank-after-adding-an-announcement-banner-396298891.html], you may need to remove the adjustments - we also have steps to [remove the announcement banner through the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-jira-announcement-banner-through-the-database-429916703.html].

*Without the workaround*
 No workaround, all variables available:
!no-workaround-all-available.png|thumbnail!

No workaround, some variables available:
!no-workaround-some-available.png|thumbnail!

*With the workaround*:
 Workaround, all variables available:
!workaround-all-available.png|thumbnail!

Workaround, some variables available:
!workaround-some-available.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an Admin, the webhooks UI does not clearly show which variables I can use within a URL

fields.description:
In a JIRA setup where a User Directory is configured to sync with a corporate LDAP or Active Directory database, distribution lists are pulled into JIRA as groups, and the members of the group are the users associated with the emails in the DL. However, when a notification is sent to one of those groups, it turns into *many* emails to all the individual members of the group instead of one email to the DL associated with the group. This is very undesirable.

It is problematic in situations where the mail servers are configured with a limit on the number of emails that can be generated from a particular IP address. In our case, our servers are set to only allow 200 emails/minute and we are now hitting this limit frequently. Our mail admins will not increase this limit, saying:
{quote}This limit helps prevent internal applications from inadvertently creating an internal DoS attack on our messaging servers. So the raising of the submission rate is not an option as this will affect corporate wide email services.

The way JIRA handles emails is not correct. They should send to the distribution list’s SMTP address so exchange can expand the list and send the messages as needed. This also bypasses all our security controls that are in place to prevent users from sending to DLs with a high number of members that are restricted.
{quote}
We would very much like to see this behavior changed so that notifications to a group (we have several instances where this happens) send only one email to the distribution list associated with the group instead of many emails to the individual members of the group.
fields.summary: Outgoing email to group should be sent to the associated distribution list not to all the individual users

fields.description: As of 2016, Microsoft Office365/Outlook supports a @Mention feature, which highlights/filters emails which explicitly call out the recipient. This feature is similar in purpose and intent to JIRA's Mention feature (available since 2013). Thus, the features are equivalent, however, the syntax of Mentions in JIRA email notifications is different and incompatible: * JIRA uses {{\[~username]}} syntax in text entry, and {{\@username}} in the user interface * Office365/Outlook expects e.g. {{\@lastname}} (plain text) and {{lastname}} (HTML) This email combination is likely to be common among enterprise customers, so interoperability should be valuable. I am aware of other requests for improving JIRA Mentions, such as JRASERVER-37777, JRASERVER-41364, but this specific request should integrate better and have more immediate benefits to a large user base. Since non-Office365/Outlook email won't necessarily honor the same @Mention syntax, this proposal should be a configurable option.
fields.summary: Make JIRA mentions compatible with Office365/Outlook's @Mention feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira allows customers to create more users than they have licenses for, which blocks main functionalities as create new issues when the user limit has been exceeded.

The following message is shown only if the administrator navigates to the Applications pages, *but it can easily be overlooked*.

{quote}
You are X users away from the maximum allowed by your license.
{quote} 

h3. Suggested Solution

Alert administrators with a pop-up alert when they log in for Jira's administrative functions. It should help them act in advance by upgrading the license or managing user access.

\\
fields.summary: Jira should alert if user count is close to reaching the license limit

fields.description:
h4. Open redirect in default servlet [CVE-2018-11784|https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-11784]

When the default servlet in Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.11, 8.5.0 to 8.5.33 and 7.0.23 to 7.0.90 returned a redirect to a directory (e.g. redirecting to '/foo/' when the user requested '/foo') a specially crafted URL could be used to cause the redirect to be generated to any URI of the attackers choice.

Fixed versions:
 * >=9.0.12

 * >=8.5.34

 * >=7.0.91

Workaround:
{quote}Use mapperDirectoryRedirectEnabled="true" and mapperContextRootRedirectEnabled="true" on the Context to ensure that redirects are issued by the Mapper rather than the default Servlet. See the Context configuration documentation for further important details.
{quote}
fields.summary: Update Tomcat to 8.5.34 to avoid CVE-2018-11784

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira pages that contain Agile reports (Velocity charts, Burn-down chart, ...) and are loaded via a iFrame in the Confluence's HTML macro do not load.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server 6.6.8
 * Jira Server 7.6.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Disable clickjacking in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/security-headers-in-jira-939919914.html] via:
{code:java}
set JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=-Dcom.atlassian.jira.clickjacking.protection.disabled=true
{code}

 # In a Confluence page, put an [iFrame in a HTML macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-put-an-iframe-into-confluence-598837531.html] that points to a Jira Agile chart URL (Velocity charts, Burn-down chart, ...)

h3. Expected Results

The page loads in the iFrame and show the report/graph.
h3. Actual Results

The page does not load, instead it show the error:
{quote}Exception: Uncaught SecurityError: Blocked a frame with origin "<Jira base URL>" from accessing a cross-origin frame.
{quote}
h3. Notes
 * The issue does not occur when loading a dashboard or an issue page.
 * This is a Jira problem since a part of the page does load. The error in the UI is show by Jira and not Confluence.
 * Adding the JVM arg {{-Dcom.atlassian.jira.clickjacking.protection.disabled=true}} should allow all pages to load in an external iFrame.

h3. Workaround

For the Agile Velocity chart, use the [Agile Velocity Chart Gadget|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215768/agile-velocity-chart-gadget?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on.
fields.summary: Jira pages containing Agile reports do not load in Confluence's HTML macro

h3. *Summary*

When Opening Image Attachments Preview In IE11 On JIRA 7.12.0 or 7.12.1, Image Just Keep Loading And Showing *SCRIPT438 Object doesn't support property or method 'assign'* Error. We are required to refresh browser for it to continue working.
h3. *Environment*

JIRA Version: Tested and confirm impacted on 7.12.0, 7.12.1
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Install JIRA 7.12.0 and startup JIRA instance
 # Create an issue and attach some attachments PNG, JPG image format files into it.
 # Access using IE11 to the issue and click on those image attachment.
 # JIRA suppose to open up image preview
 # It just keeps loading forever and in Inspect view we can see *SCRIPT438 Object doesn't support property or method 'assign'* Error

h3. *Expected Results*

We should be able to open the image attachment preview.
h3. *Actual Results*

Image preview just keeps loading and browser hang.
 !error in IE11.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Workaround*

Use others browsers such as Chrome and Firefox

In IE11: Open the attachment in a new tab
fields.summary: When Opening Image Attachments Preview In IE11 On JIRA 7.12, Image Just Keep Loading And Showing SCRIPT438 Object doesn't support property or method 'assign' Error

fields.description:
If I create a ticket by hand, I am the "created by" and "reported by" user.

When an issue is created by processing an email that was sent to Jira where I'm the default assignee, I become the "created by" and "reported by" user no matter who sent the original request in.

My email rules and workflow cannot differentiate between these events since "created by" and "reported by" are both me (let's ignore the "Assignee" because sometimes I *do* manually create tickets assigned to myself - in that instance, I'm all three: created, reported, and assignee).

Basically, if the ticket is created via email, either make the "Created by" value be the "from address" of the email sender OR set it to a dummy Jira service account so I can tell which ones were really created by me OR created via email.
fields.summary: When creating tickets via email, allow the "created by" to be a service account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When losing "temporary access to administrative functions" in Jira administrator panel you still can be viewing already loaded configuration page of RTE (Rich Text Editor).

Clicking RTE switch in {{<Jira_URL>/secure/admin/ConfigureRTE!default.jspa}} results in frequently repeating error displayed as flag (right side message). The switch will rapidly switch between enabled and disabled.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to {{<Jira_URL>/secure/admin/ConfigureRTE!default.jspa}}
# Open the same page in 2nd browser window/tab
# In 1st tab click "Drop access" link button on top of the page.
# In 2nd tab click on RTE switch "Enable rich text editor for users"

h4. Expected result

Single error is displayed informing about lost access to administrative functions.
RTE switch is moved back to previous position.

h4. Actual result

Frequently repeating error message.
RTE switch rapidly switching between enabled and disabled.
fields.summary: Frontend freaks out after enabling/disabling RTE with no temporary access to administrative functions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating to Administartion >> Issues >> Workflow, an error (The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation) is displayed. This is due to a special character injected on the Workflow XML that made the XML of that Workflow broken. When Jira tries to parse that, it fails resulting in the error previously mentioned.
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Inject special character on Workflow XML file (this could be accidental or malformed). This will cause the Workflow XML to be broken on the database.
 # When trying to access to the Workflow administration page, this will result into an error (The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation).

h3. Expected Results

Jira will mention that the Workflow XML is broken due to special characters, or even if one XML is affected, this won't affect to the whole experience and page will still be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian_jira.log file:
{code:java}
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error converting XML to workflow descriptor.: root cause: Content is not allowed in prolog. (line:1 col:1)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.loadWorkflowDescriptor(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.MemoryCacheManager$3$1.load(MemoryCacheManager.java:211)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.lambda$get$0(DelegatingCache.java:168)
{code}
Note: The error does not mention the id of the workflow that is broken. Logging the id would also be helpful in determining the broken workflow.

And this error will be displayed on the UI:

!JIRAError.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Manually check the workflow xml for all workflows in the database:
{code:sql}
select descriptor from jiraworkflows;
{code}

Looking up the Workflows on the database, it will show that the XML is malformed. Here's a comparison with a different and well formed Workflow XML displayed in DBVisualizer:

!Screen Shot 2018-10-04 at 15.50.14.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-10-04 at 15.50.05.png|thumbnail!

Currently, the XML can be either analysed and fix by finding the special character, or to just delete the workflow after identifying which Workflow XML has been broken.
{code:sql}
delete from jiraworkflows where id = <Broken_Workflow_XML_ID>;
{code}
This way, the broken XML won't be there anymore and Jira will only see well formed XML and will be able to display the Workflow Administration page.
fields.summary: Broken XML causes workflow admin page to crash

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to extract user OAuth token via REST API, they get a NullPointerException (see stack in attachment). 

h3. Environment 
* Customer has upgraded Jira from 7.2.x to 7.6.7.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Fire up Jira and Confluence instances
* Link them
* Create page in Confluence and put some Jira Macros
* Open page and approve access to Jira so it will create Auth tokens
* Have auth tokens like in attachment
* Make a DB backup of Jira
* Spin up another Jira instance
* Restore database
* Check same user auth tokens

h3. Expected Results
User auth token is retrieved

h3. Actual Results
The NPE exception is thrown as seen in attachment file.
 
h3. Notes
The workaround from https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-displays-nullpointerexception-consumer-when-deleting-application-link-776801530.html was not sufficient.

h3.Workaround
Problem has been worked around by cleaning out the existing entries from 'oauthsptoken' table and re-creating them.
fields.summary: JIRA displays NullPointerException consumer when trying to get user OAuth tokens

fields.description:
h3. Description

When users go to save updates or a new filing, they lose all their edits if the session has expired. We'd prefer not to set Tomcat session inactive timers to zero and eliminate timeouts completely, as we really don't want infinite sessions and all the risk that entails, what we'd prefer is that users are given an authentication challenge that allows them to save their pending changes immediately after successfully establishing a new session.

This happens to developers on a daily basis, the recurring loss of work is a productivity issue

h3. Workaround

If users are using Chrome,  it could be installed the Lazarus Chrome extension, or Typio Form Recovery. These extensions saves anything you type in forms even if the page errors out.
fields.summary: Give users an authentication challenge that allows them to save their pending changes immediately after successfully establishing a new session.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a situation where all agents are given permission to Assign Issues, sometimes agents do not notice that a ticket is already assigned, and they assign other's ticket on themselves. 

What we want would be a function that makes the 'Assignee" field un-editable and the 'Assign to Me' button to be hidden once an issue is already assigned to an agent.
h3. Workaround

Edit the Workflow associated with the project and in the Statuses that you want to hide the *Assign* option, click on _View Properties_ and then add the following : 
{noformat}
Property Key: jira.permission.assign.denied
Property Value: 
{noformat}
You will still see the assignee field when you are viewing the issue in that status.
fields.summary: Ability to make the 'Assignee' field un-editable and hide 'Assign to Me' button once an issue is already assigned to an agent.

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

it would be great to have a possibility to highlight stories in the backlog, which have a label or a specific attribute.

*Current situation:*

Currently, I just have the quickfilters to search directly in the backlog. When I filter the tickets, I just see e.g. the tickets labeled with "Design needed". Because I won't see all the other tickets, I can't rank them in the backlog in a proper way.

*New feature:*

With the possibility to just highlight stories in the backlog through a predefined filter (e.g. labels=design needed), I have a proper possibility to find the stories and I can directly rank them in the backlog.
fields.summary: Possibility to just highlight stories in the backlog through a predefined filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the [Managing project permissions | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver079/managing-project-permissions-950288428.html] documentation (all versions), for the permissions:
* Delete all worklogs
* Delete own worklogs
* Edit all worklogs
* Edit own worklogs

All the items note *"Also see the Work On Issues permission."* in the Explanation column of the permission, giving an indication of a relation to the *Work on issues* permission, but the permissions require that the user also has the *Work on issues* permission as a prerequisite dependent and this is not clearly stated in the explanation causing confusion in the permissions capabilities

h3. Suggested Solution
Modify the explanation to include:
{quote}
In order for a user to be able to modify the worklog on an issue, that user must also be granted the *Work On Issues* permission, see the *Work On Issues* permission.
{quote}
fields.summary: Clarification on Log Work Permissions

fields.description:
Adding links to external pages in the issue's description or a comment with the rich text editor's built in function only works with certain URLs.

I could not find any settings or related issues so I decided to make a suggestion.
----
h2. First scenario (positive)

Adding a link to "https://www.atlassian.com/" works fine. The rich text editor will show a clickable link.
h4. Text mode:
{noformat}
[Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/]
{noformat}
h4. Switching to visual mode:

[Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/]
----
h2. Second scenario (negative)

Adding a link to e.g. "notes://SRV01007/412569AD002D0EB4/" does not work.
h4. Text mode:
{noformat}
[Notes|notes://SRV01007/412569AD002D0EB4/]
{noformat}
h4. Switching to visual mode:

[Notes|notes://SRV01007/412569AD002D0EB4/]
----
h2. Conclusion

After some testing I found out that the external link feature seems to work only with URLs starting with "HTTP" or "HTTPS". Linking to Documents in external tools, such as our collaborative plattform / mail client IBM Notes, does not work. 

Copy / Paste seems to be the only (but not efficient) workaround and I would like to see this feature implemented, as Jira is a modern Web Application and adding links to a text is basic HTML.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor - External links should work with non-HTTP(S) URLs
